response.original_title: 新日本地理映画大系 本州の屋根
response.overview: In the mountains of the Chubu region,  farmers grow legumes, buckwheat, and millet. Silk cultivation and forestry are also  important sources of income. Paper production has flourished since the Meiji Period,  and precision-instrument factories have been built for assembling lenses and timepiec-  es. The natural environment is harsh but beautiful, and a local tourist industry has also developed.
response.title: The New Japanese Geography Film Series: The Roofs of Honshu
